sen.j: 左大臣（さだいじん）は、朝廷組織の最高機関、太政官の職の一つ。
sen.e: The Minister of the Left was a government post in the Council of State, the central administrative body of the Imperial Court.

The Minister of the Left was a government post in the Daijokan (Grand Council of State), the central administrative body of the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: This just reads as a chokuyaku to me, I'm afraid. The English translation has to have meaning and describing a person (which is what a minister must be) as an organization just doesn't make sense. I would suggest returning the translation to almost its original form with the addition of "Daijokan."

sen.j: 左大臣の上には太政大臣が存在するが、常置の職ではなく、その資格がある人を欠く場合は置かれず、その場合には左大臣が太政官の最高位であった。
sen.e: As the Chancellor of the State, which was above the Minister of the Left in rank, was not a permanent position, it was not appointed in the absence of a qualified person; therefore, in such a case, the Minister of the Left was the top rank in the Council of State.
